cards.title: Yin and Yang Theory
cards.description: Understand the balance of Yin and Yang as the foundation of health in traditional Chinese medicine.

cards.title: Five Elements Theory
cards.description: Explore the interplay of the Five Elements and their impact on the body and mind.

cards.title: Zang-Fu Organs
cards.description: Learn about the Zang-Fu organs and their roles in maintaining balance and well-being.

cards.title: Meridian System
cards.description: Discover the meridian system, channels that connect the body and facilitate the flow of Qi.

cards.title: Etiology and Pathogenesis
cards.description: Understand the causes and mechanisms of diseases according to traditional Chinese medicine.

cards.title: Health Preservation
cards.description: Learn practical tips for preserving health through diet, lifestyle, and seasonal adjustments.

cards.title: Qi Deficiency Health Tips
cards.description: Consume foods like astragalus, codonopsis, and jujube to boost Qi. Prevent fatigue, shortness of breath, and susceptibility to illness.

cards.title: Blood Deficiency Health Tips
cards.description: Eat foods like angelica, goji berries, and black sesame to nourish blood. Prevent anemia, dizziness, and pale complexion.

cards.title: Yang Deficiency Health Tips
cards.description: Consume warming foods like lamb, ginger, and cinnamon to strengthen Yang. Prevent cold intolerance, poor digestion, and fatigue.

cards.title: Yin Deficiency Health Tips
cards.description: Eat foods like white fungus, lily bulbs, and goji berries to nourish Yin. Prevent night sweats, dry mouth, and insomnia.

cards.title: Cardiovascular Disease Prevention
cards.description: Consume fiber-rich and antioxidant foods like oats, apples, and grapes. Control fat and salt intake, maintain moderate exercise, and avoid overexertion.

cards.title: Digestive System Disease Prevention
cards.description: Eat mild and easily digestible foods like millet porridge, yam, and pumpkin. Eat at regular intervals, avoid overeating, and manage stress.

cards.title: Respiratory System Disease Prevention
cards.description: Consume lung-nourishing foods like pears, white fungus, and lily bulbs. Avoid getting cold, monitor air quality, and engage in regular outdoor activities.

cards.title: Beauty and Skincare
cards.description: Consume collagen-rich and antioxidant foods like pig's trotters, fish maw, and goji berries. Ensure adequate sleep, reduce UV exposure, and supplement with vitamin C.

cards.title: Weight Loss
cards.description: Eat low-fat, high-fiber foods like oats, green tea, and vegetables. Maintain regular exercise, control portion sizes, and avoid high-calorie snacks.

cards.title: Immune System Boost
cards.description: Consume vitamin C and zinc-rich foods like citrus fruits, nuts, and milk. Exercise regularly, maintain a positive mindset, and ensure adequate sleep.

cards.title: Spring Health Tips
cards.description: Eat warming foods like onion, ginger, and garlic to boost Yang energy. Prevent colds and allergies, and take care of your liver.

cards.title: Summer Health Tips
cards.description: Consume cooling foods like mung beans, bitter melon, and watermelon. Prevent heatstroke and digestive issues, and stay hydrated.

cards.title: Autumn Health Tips
cards.description: Eat nourishing foods like pears, white fungus, and lily bulbs. Prevent dryness-related issues like respiratory problems and dry skin.

cards.title: Winter Health Tips
cards.description: Consume warming foods like lamb, goji berries, and red dates. Prevent cold-related illnesses and maintain kidney health.
